column4: Is anyone here familiar with installing drivers for Broadcom wifi NICs?
unless you need to be doing network monitor, ndiswrapper is really nice
and usually if ndiswrapper can't do it, no one can
I'm having problems with bcm43xx fwcutter-I have a very low signal.
yea, the bcm43xx is of poor quality right now. You can only get 11 MB out of the usual 54 MB from that driver.
I highly recommend FIRST uninstalling your drivers, THEN installing ndiswrapper
Ok, I'll try. 11 vs 54 Mb is no problem to me, I just need good reception-my speed right now is 50kB.
the speed and distance both increase or decrease proportionally, btw. :)
if you are far, you get low speeds.
if you have low speeds, it'll act as if you were farther
The WAP is directly above the office.
But my speed is slower than dial-up.
yea, it's probably the drivers, and if not, it's the device (if you haven't tested it elsewhere)
It worked fine with the WAP being much farther away.
